Embeddings

Class LayeredEmbedding

  • java.lang.Object
    • Embeddings.LayeredEmbedding

  • public class LayeredEmbedding
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to align a graph according to a layered embedding. This means that all nodes are placed on a horizontal layers such that (almost) all edges of the graph show downwards. In case of acyclic graphs, really all edges show downwards.
    Version:
    1.0.0, 11th June 2019
    Author:
    Clemens Hofstadler

      Divides the nodes of G into layers such that all edges of G show in the same direction.
      private static int crossings(Node n1, Node n2, Graph G, java.util.ArrayList<Node> upper)
      Computes the number of crossings of edges starting somewhere in the layer "upper" and reaching n1 with edges starting in upper and reaching n2.
      static void defineLayout(Graph G)
      Aligns the nodes of a graph G on horizontal layers in the unit square such that (almost) all edges of G show downwards.
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edgesToReverse(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes, java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edges)
      Computes the edges of a cyclic graph which have to be reversed in order to obtain an acyclic graph.

      Make a cyclic graph acyclic by removing loops (this is done by reverting edges).

      Returns all nodes in the set "nodes" which have no incoming edges.
      private static void reduceCrossings(Graph G, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Node>> layers)
      Tries to reduce the crossings in the layers given by the set "layers".

      • defineLayout

        public static void defineLayout(Graph G)
        Aligns the nodes of a graph G on horizontal layers in the unit square such that (almost) all edges of G show downwards.
        Parameters:
        G - A graph.

      • makeAcyclic

        private static void makeAcyclic(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edges)
        Make a cyclic graph acyclic by removing loops (this is done by reverting edges).
        Parameters:
        nodes - The nodes of a graph.
        edges - The edges of a graph.

      • edgesToReverse

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edgesToReverse(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes,
                                                          java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edges)
        Computes the edges of a cyclic graph which have to be reversed in order to obtain an acyclic graph.
        Parameters:
        nodes - Nodes of the graph.
        edges - Edges of the graph.
        Returns:
        All edges of the graph that have to be reversed to obtain an acyclic graph.

      • assignLayers

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Node>> assignLayers(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes,
                                                                           java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edges)
        Divides the nodes of G into layers such that all edges of G show in the same direction.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The nodes of the graph.
        edges - The edges of the graph.
        Returns:
        A list of lists of nodes, where each list of nodes corresponds to one layer.

      • nodesWithoutInEdges

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodesWithoutInEdges(java.util.ArrayList<Node> nodes,
                                                             java.util.ArrayList<Node[]> edges)
        Returns all nodes in the set "nodes" which have no incoming edges.
        Parameters:
        nodes - A set of nodes.
        edges - The set of all edges between the nodes of "nodes".
        Returns:
        A subset of "nodes" containing all nodes with no incoming edges.

      • reduceCrossings

        private static void reduceCrossings(Graph G,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Node>> layers)
        Tries to reduce the crossings in the layers given by the set "layers". This is done by going through the layers from top to bottom and sorting each layer with some kind of bubble sort algorithm that minimizes the total number of crossings for the current layer with the previous layer.
        Parameters:
        G - An acyclic graph.
        layers - A list of layers of the nodes of G.

      • crossings

        private static int crossings(Node n1,
                             Node n2,
                             Graph G,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Node> upper)
        Computes the number of crossings of edges starting somewhere in the layer "upper" and reaching n1 with edges starting in upper and reaching n2. n1 and n2 have to be in the same layer in the layered graph and n1 is supposed to be to the left of n2.
        Parameters:
        n1 - Node in a graph.
        n2 - Node in a graph.
        G - A graph containing n1 and n2.
        upper - The layer above the layer where n1 and n2 are from.
        Returns:
        The number of crossings of edges going out from n1 with edges going out from n2.
